ENHANCED FOR QUEST 2 + CO-OP UPDATE

The Horizon scientific research laboratory is a deceptively quiet place. When you came round, there were hundreds of the living dead all around you. All because of that damn T12 virus.

To survive and save the world from the virus, use both hands and your head: never stop shooting, pick up rounds, climb up pipes and ladders, jump onto bars and grab hold of ropes, search cupboards and throw everything you find at the zombies.

You’re free to choose whatever weapons and tactics you want. Prove your agility, imagination and accuracy.

The denizens of the Horizon station will punish you for one thing: hesitation...

* FEATURES *

●  Realistic bloody graphics in the spirit of zombie apocalypse films.
●  Use two controllers actively: fire with both hands, fire as you hang on a rope, reload your shotgun with your second hand, grab onto pipes and explore hard-to-reach areas of the station.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Fixed the bug with the vanishing red aiming point. ( v 0.9.24, 10 November)
---

*** An update specially for owners of Oculus Quest 2! ***

We have to admit that we are thrilled with the new device. 

That’s the reason that, in this update, we improved the graphics and added additional effects for Oculus 2.

Improvements include: 

1) The enemies’ appearance
2) The look of the game environment
3) Dynamic Muzzle Flash
4) Dynamic Light (in some places)

The video comparison of the game versions for Quest and Quest 2:

https://bit.ly/2GUrkiz

Also, as part of the previous co-op update, we fixed a number of bugs.

We keep improving the game, with support for both devices – for both Quest and for Quest 2.

Check out our social networks at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/deathhorizonvr
Twitter: https://twitter.com/deathhorizonvr/
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/DeathHorizonVR/
Discord: https://discord.gg/ysT9An6

***  September 24 update: *** 

Co-op + localisation update.

Invite your friends – it’s time to play together!

You asked for it – we implemented it. The co-op update is already available for download!

Now you can play through the campaign mode together with a friend! It’s always more fun to play with friends, right?

What’s new in this update:

* Added the mode of cooperative playing through campaign (co-op).

* Added localisation in 7 languages - French, German, Latin American Spanish, Korean, Japanese, Russian, and Ukrainian.

* Added weapons racks in Save Rooms. Now it’s easier to select and change the weapon.

* Added animations on the screens with collectibles.

* Added the new animations of zombies.

* Optimized memory usage on the device to minimize potential bugs associated with the game freezing.

* Fixed bugs.

---

Version: 0.9.19.9

* Added a possibility to switch between servers;

* Fixed the bug with a potential duplicate of weapon and ammo at one of the players end;

* Fixed the bug that had been making it impossible for the second player to press the button in the reactor room in case of a non-linear playthrough.

node.reviewDescription:
This game is in 1 word, excellent. 
As someone that works in VR roomscale software development, I was skeptical that the Quest 1 and Quest 2 would have decent enough processing power to pull off a standalone game which can be enjoyed for hours on end... I was wrong.

Death Horizon is quite simply amazing, I set up two roomscale zones in one room so family members could play co-op in the same game. We spent hours immersed in this title, running around shooting zombies with the decent weapon selection offered by the game.

Graphically it is what would be expected of a game running on a standalone headset; not photorealistic, but with enough detail packed in to the environments to fully immerse you in the game. The art department have done a great job with this one. Textures are clear, objects and characters are not too low poly and the guns look great. The lighting is on-point really setting the mood. One great moment was entering the reactor chamber and seeing its immense scale!

My only caveats and areas of improvement for co-op:

- There were a few instances where myself or the other person playing would clip through walls or floors in the map and not be able to get back in

- Sometimes ammo is displayed on the HUD but none of the guns would have any ammo when trying to shoot

- It would be great if the VOIP capabilites could be toggled in the settings menu, as we were experiencing audio latency being in the same room, and could already hear each other.

- We really wanted to return to our checkpoint after closing the game for the day, it would be good to have a co-op saving capability.

- Being able to hold more than 1 larger gun in our holsters would be an awesome improvement.

- Having the ability to throw the other player ammo from our own belts if they need it would help a lot.

- If a DLC came along, some outdoor environments would be a nice addition

I would 100% recommend this game to anyone with a Quest 1 and Quest 2 - it runs well on both with some obvious resolution and character improvements on the 2. 

Hopefully more environments are being worked on because I would definitely buy a DLC!
node.reviewTitle: An honest review for the developer...

developerResponse.body:
Hi ScottGibson97,
Thank you for your detailed review. 
We’re very glad that you liked our game and had fun with it. 
A special thanks for your suggestions regarding the game improvement – they are really interesting. 
As to our plans for the game further development, in the near future, we’ll release a number of the following updates: Close Combat update, Horde Mode update, the Final Chapter update. 
We sincerely hope that you’ll like the new game versions.
